1.descricao:
Enchant Wall

Enchanted Wall can attack as though it didn't have defender.

regras.texto: This is a change from the most recent wording. As was the case in the past, Animate Wall can now enchant only a Wall.

7.descricao:
Lands you control are Plains.

Nonland cards you own that aren't on the battlefield, spells you control, and nonland permanents you control are white.

You may spend white mana as though it were mana of any color. You may spend other mana only as though it were colorless mana.

regras.texto: The effect to turn all your non-land cards (including artifacts) white is the effect of a static ability. Thus, a color change on a permanent prior to Celestial Dawn entering the battlefield will be overridden by Celestial Dawn's effect.
Celestial Dawn does not change the type of lands which are not on the battlefield. Lands not on the battlefield are what they say they are.
Will not add or remove Snow Supertype from a land.

You may use a different color mana than the color required for spells and abilities that require a specific color. If you do, and the spell or ability checks the actual color of the mana, it can tell the difference.

If you pay white mana to activate an ability that can only be activated by spending another color of mana, then any limitations on activating the ability (such as the number of times it can be activated each turn) still apply as if you spent the proper color.
Celestial Dawn no longer changes mana symbols on cards.

Mana produced by spells you control and nonland permanents you control isn't affected by Celestial Dawn. Llanowar Elves will produce {G}, for example. However, any colored mana may be spent only on the colorless part of costs.
Land cards you own that aren't on the battlefield aren't changed to Plains.
If you have nonwhite mana in your mana pool when Celestial Dawn enters the battlefield, it remains there but you can spend it only on the colorless part of costs.

"Enters the battlefield" triggered abilities of lands you play won't trigger since the lands will enter the battlefield as Plains. Effects that modify how those lands enter the battlefield, however, will still work. For example, if you play a Dimir Aqueduct, it will enter the battlefield tapped as a Plains, but you won't return a land to your hand.

If you use a text-changing effect such as Mind Bend on Celestial Dawn to change the word "Plains" to a different land type, your lands are all of that new land type, and they will produce mana of the appropriate color for that type.
If a permanent enters the battlefield while Celestial Dawn is on the battlefield, and then Celestial Dawn leaves the battlefield, the permanent's color will revert to the colors in its mana cost.

8.descricao: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

regras.texto: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

9.descricao: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

regras.texto: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

10.descricao: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

regras.texto: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

11.descricao: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

regras.texto: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

12.descricao: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

regras.texto: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

14.descricao:
Flying

Sacrifice Daraja Griffin: Destroy target black creature.

15.descricao: {T}: D'Avenant Archer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

regras.texto: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

19.descricao: Search your library for an artifact or enchantment card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

regras.texto: The "shuffle and put the card on top" is a single action. If an effect is making the top card of the library face up, the second card down on the library is not revealed.
You do not have to find an artifact or enchantment card if you do not want to.

20.descricao: Pay 1 life: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ethereal Champion this turn.

21.descricao: Exile target nonwhite attacking creature. You gain life equal to its toughness.

22.descricao: Choose one — Target player gains 3 life; or prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

23.descricao: {T}: Heavy Ballista deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

25.descricao: Put four 1/1 white Citizen creature tokens onto the battlefield.

26.descricao: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

regras.texto: An "attacking creature" is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.

27.descricao: Artifacts, creatures, and lands played by your opponents enter the battlefield tapped.

regras.texto: Cards enter the battlefield tapped. They do not enter the battlefield untapped and then immediately tap, therefore they do not trigger any effects due to tapping.
It affects all opponents.
Does not affect cards that phase in.

28.descricao: {T}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.

regras.texto: If you activate the ability but Kjeldoran Royal Guard leaves the battlefield before combat damage is dealt, the combat damage from unblocked creatures won't be redirected. It will be dealt to you as normal.

29.descricao: Black creatures can't attack or block.

30.descricao: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

regras.texto: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

31.descricao:
Flying

{1}{W}: Mesa Falcon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

32.descricao: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target black spell.

33.descricao:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

34.descricao:
Flying

{1}{W}: Pearl Dragon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

36.descricao: Prevent the next 5 damage that would be dealt this turn to any number of target creatures and/or players, divided as you choose.

regras.texto: You choose the targets and you choose how to divide up the 5 damage on announcement.
You can't choose zero targets. You must choose at least one target.

37.descricao: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater. It can't be regenerated.

38.descricao: Sacrifice Resistance Fighter: Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn.

39.descricao: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

regras.texto: It only affects damage dealt by the source one time. If the source damages you a second time this turn, the damage will not be reversed.

40.descricao: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

41.descricao: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy all artifacts and enchantments. They can't be regenerated.

regras.texto: Serenity's triggered ability destroys itself too.

42.descricao: Creatures you control have vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause them to tap.)

43.descricao:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)

Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

regras.texto: Damage that is redirected is not dealt to the original creature or player, but it is dealt to the new creature or player.
You only gain the life when the triggered ability resolves. If you are reduced to zero life before the ability resolves, you will lose before gaining the life.

You gain life for all damage which is not prevented, regardless of what the creature damages (player or another creature) or the toughness of the blocking creature. If you put this on a 5/5 and it is blocked by a 1/1, you still gain 5 life.

45.descricao: When Staunch Defenders enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.

46.descricao:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)

Flying

Sunweb can't block creatures with power 2 or less.

47.descricao: Each player sacrifices the creature he or she controls with the highest converted mana cost unless he or she pays that creature's mana cost. If two or more creatures a player controls are tied for highest cost, that player chooses one.

regras.texto: The choice of creatures is made on resolution and not on announcement.
You can use mana abilities during the resolution of this spell if the player decides to pay the mana cost.
You choose whether to pay or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice the creature. You can choose to not pay if you control no creatures on resolution.

First the active player identifies the creature he or she controls with the highest mana cost (and chooses one if there's a tie) and chooses whether to sacrifice it or pay mana. Then each other player in turn order does the same. All creatures sacrificed this way are sacrificed at the same time.
Although Tariff checks the converted mana cost of the creatures on the battlefield, you need to pay the creature's actual mana cost (including color) to keep it on the battlefield.

48.descricao: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

49.descricao:
Flying

Sacrifice Unyaro Griffin: Counter target red instant or sorcery spell.

50.descricao: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.

52.descricao: Whenever an opponent casts a red spell, you gain 2 life.

regras.texto: It triggers on all opposing players.

53.descricao: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

regras.texto: Warrior's Honor affects creatures you control that are on the battlefield at the time it resolves. If you put a creature onto the battlefield later in the turn, that creature won't get the bonus.

54.descricao: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

55.descricao:
Enchant creature

When Abduction enters the battlefield, untap enchanted creature.

You control enchanted creature.

When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

regras.texto: Abduction may be cast targeting an untapped creature.

57.descricao: Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

regras.texto: If there are less than 7 cards in the library, look at all of them. Put two into your hand, and the rest in the graveyard.
This is not considered a draw or a discard.

58.descricao: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

59.descricao: {2}{U}{U}: Look at the top five cards of your library, put one of them into your hand, and exile the rest.

60.descricao: Red spells cost {2} more to cast.

62.descricao: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.

63.descricao: Change the target of target spell with a single target.

regras.texto: Once the spell resolves, the new target is considered to be targeted by the deflected spell. This will trigger any effects which trigger on being targeted.
This only targets the spell being changed, not the original or new target of the spell it is affecting.
The target of a spell that targets another spell on the stack can be changed to any other spell on the stack, even if the new target will resolve before the spell does.
You can't make a spell which is on the stack target itself.

You can choose to make a spell on the stack target this spell (if such a target choice would be legal had the spell been cast while this spell was on the stack). The new target for the deflected spell is not chosen until this spell resolves. This spell is still on the stack when new targets are selected for the spell.
If there is no other legal target for the spell, this does not change the target.
This does not check if the current target is legal. It just checks if the spell has a single target.
You choose the spell to target on announcement, but you pick the new target for that spell on resolution.
If a spell targets multiple things, you can't target it with Deflection, even if all but one of those targets has become illegal.
If a spell targets the same player or object multiple times, you can't target it with Deflection.

64.descricao: Counter target spell. If an artifact or creature spell is countered this way, put that card onto the battlefield under your control instead of into its owner's graveyard.

regras.texto: The card is put onto the battlefield, but any effects that check if the original card was "cast from your hand" will not trigger or otherwise consider the card to have been cast from your hand. The card was put onto the battlefield by the effect of Desertion instead.
This spell includes a replacement effect. If the target is an artifact or creature, it never goes to the graveyard.
If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then this card's ability does not put the card onto the battlefield. The spell continues to resolve as normal.

65.descricao: Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library. You exile the top ten cards of your library. Then each player draws up to seven cards.

regras.texto: Each player may choose to draw any number of cards from zero to seven.

First the player whose turn it is chooses how many cards to draw, then each other player in turn order chooses. Then the cards are drawn, first by the player whose turn it is, then by each other player in turn order.
This card won't be put into your graveyard until after it's finished resolving, which means it won't be shuffled into your library as part of its own effect.

66.descricao: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand both on top of your library or both on the bottom of your library.

67.descricao: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. If you do, sacrifice it unless you pay its mana cost reduced by up to {2}.

regras.texto: Any X in the creature's mana cost is zero.
The mana cost you pay includes colored mana.
The creature enters the battlefield, so it will trigger enters-the-battlefield abilities even if you have chosen to not pay.

If you choose not to pay, the creature is sacrificed immediately. No player will get priority in between the creature entering the battlefield and being sacrificed. Sacrificing the creature this way will trigger any abilities that trigger when a creature leaves the battlefield.

68.descricao:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature has flying.

69.descricao:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

When Fog Elemental attacks or blocks, sacrifice it at end of combat.

70.descricao: Target player discards two cards, then draws as many cards as he or she discarded this way.

71.descricao:
Enchant creature

Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.

73.descricao:
Flying

{1}{U}{U}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

75.descricao: Whenever an opponent casts a green spell, you draw a card.

77.descricao: You and target player exchange control of the creature you each control with the highest converted mana cost. Then exchange control of artifacts the same way. If two or more permanents a player controls are tied for highest cost, their controller chooses one of them.

regras.texto: First creatures are exchanged, then artifacts are exchanged. It's possible that the same artifact creature may be involved in both exchanges.
No permanents are targeted by this effect, so permanents with Shroud may be exchanged this way.

If one of the players doesn't control a creature at the time the exchange would be made, that part of the effect does nothing, but the exchange of artifacts will still happen. Similarly, if one of the players doesn't control an artifact at the time the exchange would be made, that part of the effect does nothing.

78.descricao: An opponent chooses one — You draw three cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep; or you search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle your library.

79.descricao: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk.

80.descricao: Tap all lands target player controls and empty his or her mana pool.

regras.texto: Since this is an instant, your opponent may use instants in response to the casting of this spell. Note that such spells and abilities will be resolved before the mana pool is emptied by the Mana Short. This makes it useless as a countermeasure for spells. To use it effectively, you need to use it during Upkeep and even then it will not prevent the use of instant spells and abilities.
If you play Mana Short in response to a spell, it will have no effect on that spell since the mana has already been paid.
It even taps lands that do not produce mana.

81.descricao: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.

regras.texto: The card does not go to the graveyard before being put on the library.

This card has a self replacement. This means that it replaces going to the graveyard before any other effect can replace that event. If Flashback is applied, however, Flashback will change the destination.
If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then it does not go to its owner's library.

83.descricao: Search your library for an instant or sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

regras.texto: You do not have to find an instant or sorcery card if you do not want to.

84.descricao:
Enchant land

As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.

Enchanted land is the chosen type.

regras.texto: Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

86.descricao: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into his or her library.

regras.texto: If there are no creatures in the player's library, then the target creature is still destroyed, you see all the cards in that player's library, and then they shuffle and continue play.
If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Polymorph would resolve, the entire spell is countered. Nothing else happens.
If there are no creature cards in the player's library, all the cards in that library are revealed, then the library is shuffled. (The targeted creature remains destroyed.)
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.
If the targeted creature has indestructible, it's still a legal target -- it just isn't destroyed. The rest of Polymorph's effect happens as normal.

87.descricao: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands with mana abilities he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.

regras.texto: Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.

When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not "tapped for mana". If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.

Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tappped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

88.descricao: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

regras.texto: If both players run out of cards during this effect, the game is a draw.

90.descricao: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.

regras.texto: If one of the players has a negative life total, you use their actual life total for determining the difference. If that difference is five or less, then the other player receives the negative life total.
If an effect says that a player can't lose life, that player can't exchange life totals with a player who has a lower life total; in that case, the exchange won't happen.

91.descricao:
Enchant land

Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

regras.texto: Whenever the land is tapped for any reason, the ability triggers.

92.descricao: Discard X cards, then return a card from your graveyard to your hand for each card discarded this way. Exile Recall.

regras.texto: You don't discard cards until Recall resolves. If you don't have X cards in your hand at that time, you discard all the cards in your hand.

You don't choose which cards in your graveyard you'll return to your hand until after you discard cards. You choose a card in your graveyard for each card you discarded, then you put all cards chosen this way into your hand at the same time. You may choose to return some or all of the cards you just discarded.

93.descricao: Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

regras.texto: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

95.descricao:
Flying

When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

96.descricao: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

98.descricao:
Flying

Whenever Sibilant Spirit attacks, defending player may draw a card.

regras.texto: Your opponent does not have to draw a card if they don't want to.

99.descricao: {T}, Sacrifice two lands: Draw three cards, then discard one of them.

100.descricao: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)

regras.texto: Alternative costs, additional costs, cost increases, and cost reductions don’t affect a spell’s converted mana cost.

If the target spell has {X} in its converted mana cost, include the value chosen for that X when determining the value of the {X} in Spell Blast’s mana cost. For example, if you wish to counter Volcanic Geyser (a spell with mana cost {X}{R}{R}) whose X is 7, you’ll need to choose 9 for Spell Blast’s X and pay {9}{U}.

101.descricao: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

102.descricao: Tap up to three target creatures without flying.

103.descricao: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

105.descricao: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)

107.descricao:
Flying

Wind Spirit can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.

108.descricao:
Players play with their hands revealed.

If a player would draw a card, he or she reveals it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.

regras.texto: If someone pays the cost, then the card was never drawn or discarded. It just gets put into the graveyard directly from the library.
This is continuous replacement effect that modifies a draw.
If a spell or ability causes more than one card to be drawn, draw the cards one at a time and deal with this replacement before drawing the next card.

When using Dredge with this, you have two choices. You can immediately replace the draw with Dredge, or you can apply Zur's Weirding's replacement. If the latter, you first resolve Zur's Weirding's ability, then if you're going to draw the card, decide whether or not to replace that draw with Dredge.

109.descricao: {B}, {T}: Tap target creature. Abyssal Hunter deals damage equal to Abyssal Hunter's power to that creature.

regras.texto: The ability can target an already tapped creature.

110.descricao:
Flying

Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.

111.descricao: Look at target player's hand and choose two cards from it. Put them on top of that player's library in any order.

112.descricao: Put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.

113.descricao:
Enchant land

When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.

114.descricao:
{T}, Sacrifice a Swamp: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

115.descricao: Sacrifice Blood Pet: Add {B} to your mana pool.

regras.texto: Because combat damage resolves immediately after it is assigned, you cannot sacrifice Blood Pet in between assigning and dealing combat damage. The last chance you have to sacrifice it before combat damage is dealt is during the Declare Blockers step.

116.descricao: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

117.descricao: Bog Rats can't be blocked by Walls.

118.descricao: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

119.descricao: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.

120.descricao: Black spells you cast cost {B} more to cast.

121.descricao: Search your library and graveyard for five cards and exile the rest. Put the chosen cards on top of your library in any order. You lose half your life, rounded up.

regras.texto: You lose the life during resolution.
If your graveyard and library combined contain five or more cards, you must choose five cards from among them. You can't choose to find fewer than that.
If your graveyard and library combined contain fewer than five cards, all of those cards will wind up in your library.

123.descricao: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

124.descricao: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

125.descricao:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)

Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.

126.descricao:
Non-Eye creatures you control can't attack.

Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore can't be blocked except by Walls.

127.descricao:
Flying

Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.

regras.texto: Can sacrifice itself.

128.descricao: Destroy target creature that was dealt damage this turn. It can't be regenerated.

regras.texto: Fatal Blow can't target a creature that hasn't been dealt damage this turn.

Fatal Blow cares whether the creature had been dealt damage during the turn, not whether there is still damage on it. If the creature had regenerated, causing all damage to clear, Fatal Blow can still target and destroy it.

129.descricao:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)

Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

132.descricao:
If you would draw a card, return a card from your graveyard to your hand instead. If you can't, you lose the game.

If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere, exile that card instead.

regras.texto: It will replace itself being sent to the graveyard, and exile itself.
The second ability is a replacement effect, not a triggered ability. The card never gets to the graveyard.
The "if you can't" in the first ability refers to putting the card in your hand, as well as being unable to choose a card. Thus, if you can't choose a card during resolution, you lose the game.
If more than one card is being drawn due to a single effect, apply the replacement as if the cards were being drawn one at a time.

133.descricao: If Gravebane Zombie would die, put Gravebane Zombie on top of its owner's library instead.

134.descricao: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

regras.texto: A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

136.descricao:
When Hecatomb enters the battlefield, sacrifice Hecatomb unless you sacrifice four creatures.

Tap an untapped Swamp you control: Hecatomb deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

regras.texto: If you have less than 4 creatures, you do not partially sacrifice. You pay 4 creatures or none.
The sacrifice is done as a triggered ability just after it enters the battlefield. It is not done on casting.
You choose whether to sacrifice creatures or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice Hecatomb. You can choose to not sacrifice creatures if you no longer control this card on resolution.

137.descricao: When Hidden Horror enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.

regras.texto: When the ability resolves, you choose whether to sacrifice the creature or perform the other action. If you can't perform the other action, then you must sacrifice the creature.
If the creature is no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, you may still perform the action if you want.

138.descricao: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

139.descricao: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.

regras.texto: If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10.

140.descricao:
When Kjeldoran Dead enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.

{B}: Regenerate Kjeldoran Dead.

regras.texto: The sacrifice is a triggered ability and not a cost.
When Kjeldoran Dead's enters-the-battlefield ability resolves, if you don't control any other creatures, you must sacrifice Kjeldoran Dead itself.

141.descricao:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature has swampwalk.

143.descricao: Look at target player's hand and choose X cards from it. That player discards those cards.

regras.texto: The target player decides what order to put the cards in the graveyard. You decide which cards, but they do the discarding.

144.descricao:
Flying

Pay 1 life: Regenerate Mischievous Poltergeist.

145.descricao: {3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return Necrosavant from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

regras.texto: The ability is activated while this card is in the graveyard.

146.descricao:
Flying

Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

regras.texto: If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
Nightmare's power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.
The ability that defines Nightmare’s power and toughness works everywhere, not just on the battlefield.
Nightmare’s ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

147.descricao: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. Put that card on top of that player's library.

148.descricao: Destroy all green creatures. They can't be regenerated.

149.descricao:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.

{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

regras.texto: Each activation is considered a new damage effect. An activation can only be 1 point of damage.
Note that "until end of turn" effects wear off after "at the beginning of the end step" triggered abilities, so an artifact that animates until end of turn can keep this on the battlefield.

It will stay on the battlefield if there is a creature that is put into the graveyard during the end step. This is because this ability will not trigger at all if there is at least one creature on the battlefield as the end step begins.

151.descricao: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals his or her hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.

152.descricao: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

regras.texto: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

153.descricao: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

155.descricao:
When Sengir Autocrat enters the battlefield, put three 0/1 black Serf creature tokens onto the battlefield.

When Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield, exile all Serf tokens.

regras.texto: When it leaves the battlefield, it exiles all Serf tokens on the battlefield and not just the ones it generated or just the ones under your control.

156.descricao: {B}{B}, Pay 2 life, Sacrifice a Swamp: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

157.descricao: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target white spell.

158.descricao: Target opponent discards a card at random, then discards a card.

159.descricao: Syphon Soul deals 2 damage to each other player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

160.descricao: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

161.descricao: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.

162.descricao:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk.

Other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."

163.descricao: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, Æther Flash deals 2 damage to it.

regras.texto: This is not a targeted ability, so it deals damage to creatures that can't be targeted by spells and abilities.

164.descricao: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

165.descricao: {R}, {T}: Anaba Shaman deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

167.descricao: When Balduvian Horde enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.

regras.texto: You choose whether to discard or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice this card. You can choose to not discard even if you no longer control this card on resolution.

168.descricao: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.

170.descricao:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature has mountainwalk.

171.descricao:
Enchant land

You control enchanted land.

172.descricao:
Flying

{X}, {T}: Crimson Hellkite deals X damage to target creature. Spend only red mana this way.

173.descricao: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

regras.texto: Whether or not a creature is without flying is only checked on resolution.

174.descricao: Creatures you control have haste. (They can attack and {T} as soon as they come under your control.)

regras.texto: If an attacking creature loses haste, perhaps because Fervor leaves the battlefield after attackers have been declared, it won't be removed from combat.

175.descricao: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.

regras.texto: If you end up skipping the extra turn that is gained, you do not lose the game.
If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

177.descricao:
Enchant creature

{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

regras.texto: This ability can be activated by Firebreathing's controller, not the enchanted creature's controller (in case they're different players).
The ability affects whichever creature is enchanted by Firebreathing at the time the ability resolves. The bonus remains even if Firebreathing stops enchanting that creature.

178.descricao: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains first strike until end of turn.

regras.texto: The +3/+3 is also only until end of turn.

179.descricao: {R}: Flame Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

182.descricao: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.

183.descricao: Whenever Goblin Elite Infantry blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

185.descricao: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

regras.texto: Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

186.descricao: When Goblin Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Goblin cards and reveal those cards. Shuffle your library, then put them on top of it in any order.

regras.texto: You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

187.descricao: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.

regras.texto: The token Goblins can be sacrificed to the Warrens to generate new Goblins.

188.descricao:
Hammer of Bogardan deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

{2}{R}{R}{R}: Return Hammer of Bogardan from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

190.descricao: Each player may bid life for control of target creature. You start the bidding with a bid of 0. In turn order, each player may top the high bid. The bidding ends if the high bid stands. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid and gains control of the creature. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

regras.texto: This is a life loss and not a life payment so you can bid more life than you have.

191.descricao: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

192.descricao: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. They can't be regenerated.

193.descricao: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

194.descricao: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.

regras.texto: This card has a triggered ability that causes a separate effect for 1 point of damage each time a land is tapped for mana.
This ability is not a mana ability. It goes on the stack and can be responded to.
The ability will trigger each time a land is tapped for mana. Each ability is separate.

If any lands are tapped for mana while a player is casting a spell or activating an ability, Manabarbs's ability will trigger that many times and wait. When the player finishes casting that spell or activating that ability, it's put on the stack, then Manabarbs's triggered abilities are put on the stack on top of it. The Manabarbs abilities will resolve first.

On the other hand, a player can tap lands for mana, let the Manabarbs triggered abilities be put on the stack, and then respond to those abilities by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the spell or ability will resolve first.

196.descricao: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.

regras.texto: You do not take the 3 points of damage if the ability is countered because the target is illegal.

198.descricao: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.

199.descricao: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

regras.texto: You can assign damage to multiple targets and are not forced to assign the same amount of damage to each target.
You can't do fractional points of damage.
The number of targets must be at least 1 and at most 4. You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

200.descricao: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

201.descricao: {1}{R}: Reckless Embermage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to itself.

202.descricao: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

regras.texto: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.
Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

205.descricao: Destroy all artifacts. They can't be regenerated.

206.descricao: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

207.descricao:
Flying

{R}: Spitting Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

208.descricao: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.

211.descricao: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

212.descricao: Vertigo deals 2 damage to target creature with flying. That creature loses flying until end of turn.

214.descricao:
Flying

Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

215.descricao: Volcanic Geyser deals X damage to target creature or player.

216.descricao:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)

{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

217.descricao:
Flying

{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

218.descricao: {2}{G}{G}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.

220.descricao: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

221.descricao: Creatures can't be the targets of spells.

222.descricao: Target player untaps all basic lands he or she controls.

223.descricao: {3}{G}, {T}: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

regras.texto: The decision of whether to tap or untap is made on resolution.

224.descricao: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

225.descricao: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.

regras.texto: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have Flying, so they can't block this.

227.descricao: Put target land on top of its owner's library.

228.descricao: Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature.

regras.texto: When combined with an effect that reads "Each creature you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures," none of your creatures can be blocked.

229.descricao: {T}: Femeref Archers deals 4 damage to target attacking creature with flying.

230.descricao: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

regras.texto: Fog has no effect on damage that's already been dealt.

233.descricao: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

234.descricao: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

regras.texto: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

237.descricao: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

regras.texto: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

238.descricao: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

regras.texto: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

240.descricao:
Enchant creature

All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

regras.texto: Lure does not give a creature the ability to block the Lured creature, it just forces those creatures which are already able to block the Lured creature to do so.
If a Lured creature is in a band, only blockers able to block the Lured creature are affected by the Lure.
The opponent does not have to activate any abilities in an attempt to make his or her creatures block. More specifically, a cost to block of zero mana is an optional cost you can choose not to pay.

241.descricao: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.

regras.texto: Creatures are only put into a graveyard for having 0 toughness when state-based actions are checked. If Maro's toughness goes to 0 during the announcement or resolution of a spell or ability and then goes back up above 0 before the end of that announcement or resolution, it won't be put into your graveyard when state-based actions are checked.

242.descricao: Each player draws a card for each creature card in his or her graveyard.

244.descricao: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

245.descricao: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

regras.texto: Can be used on a creature without Flying with no effect.

246.descricao: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

regras.texto: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

248.descricao:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)

{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

250.descricao: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a basic land card this way, draw a card.

regras.texto: The first sentence is a continuous ability. You reveal the card when you draw it, during the resolution of any draw effect. The second sentence is a triggered ability, and thus will wait until the entire draw effect finishes resolving before you do it.

253.descricao: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.

255.descricao: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.

regras.texto: This spell increases the number of lands you can play in a turn. The land cards are played as you would normally play lands.

256.descricao: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

regras.texto: Protection from Green does not stop the Basilisk's ability because the ability is not targeted.

The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

260.descricao: When Uktabi Orangutan enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.

261.descricao:
Uktabi Wildcats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control.

{G}, Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate Uktabi Wildcats.

262.descricao:
Forestwalk

{1}{G}{G}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn.

263.descricao: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

regras.texto: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Can fetch a snow land.

264.descricao: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.

regras.texto: This does not trigger on the moving of an Aura from one permanent to another.

266.descricao: Each player puts a 1/1 green Cat creature token onto the battlefield for each untapped Forest he or she controls.

268.descricao:
Enchant land

Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

regras.texto: The additional mana is not an ability of the land and is not something the land can produce.

269.descricao: Search your library for a creature card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

regras.texto: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

270.descricao: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

271.descricao: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

272.descricao:
You may choose not to untap Amber Prison during your untap step.

{4}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land. That permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Amber Prison remains tapped.

273.descricao: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

regras.texto: This triggers on any land entering the battlefield. This includes playing a land or putting a land onto the battlefield using a spell or ability.
It determines the land's controller at the time the ability resolves. If the land leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the land's last controller before it left is used.

274.descricao: Sacrifice a creature: Add {2} to your mana pool.

275.descricao: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, put a 5/5 colorless Djinn artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you.

regras.texto: The coin is flipped on resolution and not on declaration of the ability.

276.descricao:
Charcoal Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

277.descricao: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

278.descricao: Activated abilities of creatures can't be activated.

regras.texto: Cursed Totem does not prevent creature cards which are not on the battlefield from having their abilities activated.
Cursed Totem can prevent mana abilities from being activated.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]

279.descricao: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

280.descricao: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

281.descricao: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.

regras.texto: You can use it on yourself.

282.descricao: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

283.descricao: {3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Return it to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)

284.descricao:
Fire Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

285.descricao: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

288.descricao: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Grinning Totem: Search target opponent's library for a card and exile it. Then that player shuffles his or her library. Until the beginning of your next upkeep, you may play that card. At the beginning of your next upkeep, if you haven't played it, put it into its owner's graveyard.

regras.texto: You may choose to find any kind of card, including a land. You must exile a card (unless the opponent's library is empty); you can't fail to find anything.

"Until the beginning of your next upkeep" means the effect wears off as soon as your next upkeep starts. Your last chance to play the card is usually the End step of the player who immediately precedes you.

The exiled card is played using the normal rules for timing and priority for its card type, as well as any other applicable restrictions. You'll have to pay its mana cost. The only thing that's different is you're casting it from the Exile zone.

289.descricao: {5}, {T}: Put a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wasp onto the battlefield. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

290.descricao: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.

regras.texto: If Howling Mine leaves the battlefield before it resolves, then the last known tap or untap state of the card is used for resolution.
It does not trigger at all if this is tapped at the start of the draw step, and it checks this again on resolution.
The additional draw is separate from any other draw during your draw step. It happens when the triggered ability resolves.
The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.

291.descricao: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

292.descricao: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

293.descricao: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.

294.descricao: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

296.descricao: Whenever Lead Golem attacks, it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

297.descricao:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

298.descricao:
Marble Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

299.descricao: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

300.descricao: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

regras.texto: Can be used on a player with less than 2 cards in their library. It will remove 0 or 1 cards if that is all that is available.
It is not a draw effect so it will not cause a player with less than 2 cards in their library to lose.
Since you are putting more than one card in the graveyard at one time, the affected player can choose the order the 2 cards go in.

301.descricao:
Moss Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

302.descricao: {1}, {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

305.descricao: {3}: Patagia Golem gains flying until end of turn.

306.descricao: {4}, {T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

307.descricao: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.

308.descricao: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

regras.texto: In zones other than the battlefield, Primal Clay is 0/0.

If another permanent enters the battlefield as a copy of Primal Clay, the controller of that permanent will get to make a new choice. The copy won't necessarily have the same power, toughness, and abilities as the original.
If a creature that's already on the battlefield becomes a copy of Primal Clay, it copies the power, toughness, and abilities that were chosen for Primal Clay when it entered the battlefield.

309.descricao: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

310.descricao: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skull Catapult deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

311.descricao:
Sky Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

312.descricao: {X}, Sacrifice Snake Basket: Put X 1/1 green Snake creature tokens onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

regras.texto: It used to make Cobra tokens. Now it makes Snake tokens.

313.descricao: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

regras.texto: If animated so it is a creature, it can be triggered off its own destruction.

314.descricao:
Each player may play an additional land during each of his or her turns.

Whenever a land is tapped for mana, return it to its owner's hand.

regras.texto: If a land is tapped for mana and sacrificed all in one action, it goes to the graveyard before the Cauldron can return it to the player's hand.
If a land is tapped for mana, it is returned to its owner's hand as a triggered ability.
Having multiples of these on the battlefield means you can play an additional land for each one.

315.descricao: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in his or her hand on the bottom of his or her library in any order, then draws that many cards.

regras.texto: You do your normal draw before this ability is put on the stack.
If you have more than one of these, each effect triggers separately.

316.descricao: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

317.descricao: {T}: Look at the top card of target player's library. If it's a nonland card, you may pay 2 life. If you do, put it into that player's graveyard.

318.descricao: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

319.descricao:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool. Adarkar Wastes deals 1 damage to you.

320.descricao:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Brushland deals 1 damage to you.

321.descricao:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.

{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

regras.texto: The first ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

If you tap City of Brass while you are casting a spell or activating an ability, its ability will trigger and wait. When you finish casting that spell or activating that ability, it's put on the stack, then City of Brass's triggered ability is put on the stack on top of it. That ability will resolve first.

On the other hand, you can tap City of Brass, put its triggered ability on the stack, and then respond to that ability by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the instant spell or activated ability will resolve first.

322.descricao:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}, Sacrifice Crystal Vein: Add {2} to your mana pool.

323.descricao:
Dwarven Ruins enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

{T}, Sacrifice Dwarven Ruins: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.

324.descricao:
Ebon Stronghold enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

{T}, Sacrifice Ebon Stronghold: Add {B}{B} to your mana pool.

325.descricao:
Havenwood Battleground enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

{T}, Sacrifice Havenwood Battleground: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.

326.descricao:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Karplusan Forest deals 1 damage to you.

327.descricao:
Ruins of Trokair enters the battlefield tapped.
